pull.title: log: Mitigate disk filling attacks by rate limiting LogPrintf, LogInfo, LogWarning, LogError
pull.body:
This revives the work done by @dergoegge in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/21603. The approach is largely the same except that `std::source_location` is used under-the-hood now that we can use c++20 features. The logging functions have also changed slightly since that PR was opened, so work has been done to preserve the intent of the original rate limiting change. I have tried to give commit attribution where possible (unfortunately I was not able to figure out how to type ö in vim).

**Approach:**
Each source code location is given an hourly logging quota of 1MiB of logging per hour. Logging is only dropped from source locations that exceed the quota.
- Only logging to disk is rate limited. Logging to console is not rate limited.
- Printing with the category argument is not rate limited.
- `UpdateTip: new best=[…]` is logged with the new `UNCONDITIONAL_ALWAYS` category to avoid rate limiting. High log volume is expected for that source location during IBD.
- When logging is restarted a tally of how many messages/bytes were dropped is printed.
- Log rate limiting can be disabled with the -ratelimitlogging config option.
- All logs will be prefixed with [*] if there is at least one source location that is currently being suppressed.

For some reason, the CI is failing on a Windows build and I can't figure out why. I believe it's because the file name returned by `std::source_location` isn't standardized.

tree 2dd2bab15b76ca85fb203149cb77d99e3bdae116
parent 2df824f4e62b6bc569044819cd64f66f3839ba13
author Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1747756043 -0400
committer Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1748026431 -0400

log: Introduce LogRateLimiter class

The LogRateLimiter class implements a fixed window rate limiter. The
rate limiter allows a fixed amount of bytes to be consumed within a
fixed time window.

Co-Authored-By: Niklas Gogge <n.goeggi@gmail.com>

author Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1748009717 -0400
committer Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1748026431 -0400

log: use std::source_location instead of __FILE__, __LINE__ macros

The std::source_location type stores, among other things, the file
name and line number of a source code location. We get rid of the
macro usage and use std::source_location::current() where applicable.
In a later commit, we use this type as the key type in both an
unordered_map and unordered_set to keep track of rate limiters for
each location.

Co-Authored-By: Niklas Gogge <n.goeggi@gmail.com>

verification.payload:
tree 8faf4ece69571a162568f1687907d867f9025fb5
parent 4b63f850376f6ad5797a914c357fac9b4b093583
author Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1748020144 -0400
committer Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1748026432 -0400

log: Add two new categories for unconditional logging

We create two new categories `UNCONDITIONAL_ALWAYS` and
`UNCONDITIONAL_RATE_LIMITED` that are always enabled by default.

LogInfo, LogWarning, and LogError now log using the
`UNCONDITIONAL_RATE_LIMITED` category which will start to apply
rate limiting in a later commit.

For some log locations, it might be safe to allow more frequent
logging without rate limiting. These locations should use the
`UNCONDITIONAL_ALWAYS` category.

Co-Authored-By: Niklas Gogge <n.goeggi@gmail.com>

validation: exempt UpdateTipLog from rate limiting

UpdateTipLog logs every time a new tip is activated. This occurs at
an increased frequency during IBD and should therefore be exempt
from rate limiting.

tree 118747cf9f89ec8ee1d5d325289bffda3b2e1490
parent 1124e40477b7fd60fafb814c85d324b18f374a77
author Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1748021015 -0400
committer Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1748026432 -0400

log: Add rate limiting to LogPrintf, LogInfo, LogWarning, and LogError

To mitigate disk-filling attacks caused by unsafe usages of LogPrintf and
friends, we rate-limit them by used the fixed window rate limiter
(BCLog::LogRateLimiter) introduced in an earlier commit.

The rate limiting logic is applied per source location instead of
globally. A source location is allowed to log up to 1MiB per hour.
Source locations that violate the limit will have their logs suppressed
for up to one hour.

Co-Authored-By: Niklas Gogge <n.goeggi@gmail.com>

committer Eugene Siegel <elzeigel@gmail.com> 1748026433 -0400

test: Mark ~DebugLogHelper as noexcept(false)

We mark ~DebugLogHelper as noexcept(false) to be able to catch the
exception it throws. This lets us use it in test in combination with
BOOST_CHECK_THROW and BOOST_CHECK_NO_THROW to check that certain log
messages are (not) logged.

If your review is incorrectly listed, please react with 👎 to this comment and the bot will ignore it on the next update.
<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#30595](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/30595) (kernel: Introduce initial C header API by TheCharlatan)
* [#29641](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29641) (scripted-diff: Use LogInfo over LogPrintf [WIP, NOMERGE, DRAFT] by maflcko)
* [#29415](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29415) (Broadcast own transactions only via short-lived Tor or I2P connections by vasild)
* [#29256](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/29256) (log, refactor: Allow log macros to accept context arguments by ryanofsky)
* [#26812](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/26812) (test: add end-to-end tests for CConnman and PeerManager by vasild)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
<!--5faf32d7da4f0f540f40219e4f7537a3-->
### LLM Linter (✨ experimental)

Possible typos and grammar issues:

- Excessive logging detected from %s:%d (%s): >%d MiB logged during the last hour.Suppressing logging -> Excessive logging detected from %s:%d (%s): >%d MiB logged during the last hour. Suppressing logging [missing space after period]

<sup>drahtbot_id_0520</sup>
Any thoughts about adding some kind of dying gasp so that if a node crashes or hits some fatal error the most recent unfiltered log can be saved?

<!--85328a0da195eb286784d51f73fa0af9-->
🚧 At least one of the CI tasks failed.
<sub>Task `lint`: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/runs/42810774045</sub>
<sub>LLM reason (✨ experimental): The CI failure is due to linting errors related to `std::filesystem` and locale dependence.
</sub>

<details><summary>Hints</summary>

Try to run the tests locally, according to the documentation. However, a CI failure may still
happen due to a number of reasons, for example:

* Possibly due to a silent merge conflict (the changes in this pull request being
incompatible with the current code in the target branch). If so, make sure to rebase on the latest
commit of the target branch.

* A sanitizer issue, which can only be found by compiling with the sanitizer and running the
  affected test.

* An intermittent issue.

Leave a comment here, if you need help tracking down a confusing failure.

</details>

> if a node crashes or hits some fatal error the most recent unfiltered log can be saved?

Does unfiltered here mean a log line that was rate limited or does it mean something else in this context? I think that we would need to know ahead of time if we were going to crash to save the most recent unfiltered log unless we somehow always cache it?

Concept ACK

Thanks for picking this up!
